product_description: COCOYO best value training pads offer our customers a more affordable way to train puppies or assist aging dogs. Every COCOYO training pad consists of 5 layers of materials. The first layer is made of non-woven cloth, which allows dog urine flow through to the absorbent core quickly. The second layer is made of paper tissue, added with dog attractant. The third layer is a mix of super-absorbent polymer and fluff pulp, which forms the absorbent core that can absorb and turn dog urine to gel. The absorbent core can hold up to 2 cups of liquid. The fourth layer is also made of paper tissue. The back layer is made of water-proof PE film, which prevents wetting your floor.

Directions 1.Place a COCOYO training pad on the floor away from your dog’s food and bed, plastic side down and tissue side up. 2. For initial training, put your dog on the pad several times so that your dog can smell the pad. Continue to bring your dog back to the pad until he or she relieves him or herself on the pad and then award your dog a treat immediately. 3. As training progresses, move the pad closer and closer to an outside door. 4. Dispose of soiled pads and replace as needed.

product_description: Training Pads are ideal for puppies and dogs that stay indoors for long periods of time. What you should do; Unfold the training pad and place it in a confined area. (Blue plastic side down). It is important to place your puppy or dog on the training pad several times a day in order to get him used it. on the average, a puppy must relieve himself every few hours, based on his age (a 2 month old puppy every 2 hours, a 3 month old every hours etc). If your pet relieves himself somewhere other than the designated spot where the pad is placed, bring him back to the correct spot immediately. Keep in mind that your pet will have to relive himself shortly after a meal and will need to eliminate more frequently during the summer when his water intake is higher. The minute your dog begins to relieve himself on the pad, be sure to use cures like “go potty”. You should use this cue every time that your dog relives himself on the pad so that he associates the phrase with the action of elimination. Every time that your pet used the pad successfully, make sure that you give him a treat and lots of praise. Treating helps your dog to understand that he is doing what you want him to do. Always remember to dispose of soiled pads and replace them as needed. When your pet begins to relieve himself on the pads, on consistent basic, it is time to begin moving the pad closer to the door. Keep moving the pads closer to the door until they are actually outside. At this time, the training process will be complete.

Directions 1.Decide where you will place your pads.Never place the pads in the area where your pet will be eating,drinking or sleeping.2.Open the package of pads,unfold one,and let your pet sniff it.Praise your pet while they are investigating-this can help prevent them from being afraid of the pad. 3.Unfold and place the pad on the floor,plastic side down and white absorbent side up.4.Lead your pet onto the pad for initial trtaining and allow them to smell the specially treated pheromone-scented attractant. 5.Allow your pet to relieve itself and then immediately reward them with praise and/or a treat to reinforce the positive behavior.If they do not relieve themselves immediately,take them back several times until thet are successful.If the pet relieves themselves somewhere other than the pad,lead them back to the end until they are successful. 6.Dispose of the soiled pad and replace with a fresh one frequently.
